name: treatment of metal scrap, mixed, for recycling, unsorted, sorting | aluminium scrap, post-consumer, prepared for melting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/22420/documentation

This activity represents the treatment of mixed metal scrap from separate collection, i.e. a source-segregated municipal solid waste fraction, through sorting for recycling. Sorting of waste tinplate, ferrous metals and aluminium from residues and from each other in Switzerland, yielding individual material fractions for tinplate, ferrous scrap, and aluminium.

The activity starts with 'metal scrap, mixed, unsorted' being available to the sorting facility.

The activity ends with 'metal scrap, mixed, unsorted' being sorted and 'aluminium scrap, post-consumer, prepared for melting', 'iron scrap, sorted, pressed' and 'tinplate scrap, sorted' being available for transportation at the gates of the sorting facility.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data mainly reflecting situation in Switzerland in 2012.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are sourced from plants located or activities taking place in Switzerland and/or relevant literature sources.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology encountered in CH for the underlying time frame: The mixed metal scrap is sorted using magnetic and eddy current separators.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The sorting process was modeled from primary industrial data on the diesel consumption and assuming an electricity consumption of 0.01 kWh/kg (based on the existing ecoinvent dataset on the sorting of iron in Europe). The capital equipment (infrastructure) requirements were modeled based on a newly inventoried waste preparation facility in Switzerland.

exchanges.description: Based on Haupt et al. (2017): 1 kg of "aluminium, in mixed metal scrap", yields 0.98 kg of "aluminium scrap, post consumer, prepared for melting" after the sorting process. The impurities are collected as municipal solid waste stream.

flow.name: aluminium scrap, post-consumer, prepared for melting
